--- title: "Intro to mixed models" --- ## Content - Introduction to mixed models ## Learning objectives At the end of the session, students should be capable of - determining the structure of an experimental design with random and fixed effects - correctly determining whether effects are crossed or nested - setting up a linear mixed model ## Readings - [Chapter 6 Random and Mixed-Effects Models](https://stat.ethz.ch/~meier/teaching/anova/random-and-mixed-effects-models.html) of Lukas Meier's ANOVA and Mixed Models: A Short Intro Using R] - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 10](https://lbelzile.github.io/math80667a/10-mixed.html) of the course notes ## Complementary readings - {{< fa book >}} Chapters 10 and 15 of @Maxwell.Delaney.Kelley:2017. ## Slides

View all slides in new window Download PDF of all slides

``` ::: ::: ## Code - [R script](/content/MATH80667A-10-content.R) - [SPSS script](/content/MATH80667A-10-content.sps) :::{.callout-tip} **Fun fact**: If you type ? (or shift + /) while going through the slides, you can see a list of slide-specific commands. :::
